project.component: { "keyToString": { ".NET Project.Jarvis V2 Console.executor": "Run", "ASKED_SHARE_PROJECT_CONFIGURATION_FILES": "true", "Docker.Jarvis V2 Console/Dockerfile.executor": "Run", "Docker.Jarvis_V2_Console/Dockerfile: Compose Deployment.executor": "Run", "RunOnceActivity.ShowReadmeOnStart": "true", "RunOnceActivity.git.unshallow": "true", "SHARE_PROJECT_CONFIGURATION_FILES": "true", "git-widget-placeholder": "master", "node.js.detected.package.eslint": "true", "node.js.detected.package.tslint": "true", "node.js.selected.package.eslint": "(autodetect)", "node.js.selected.package.tslint": "(autodetect)", "nodejs_package_manager_path": "npm", "vue.rearranger.settings.migration": "true" } }

task.summary: Default task

Add initial implementation of Jarvis V2 Console project
Introduced the Jarvis V2 Console project with core structure, including `Program.cs`, `Logger.cs`, Docker support, and build configuration. Added supporting files such as `compose.yaml`, `.gitignore`, `.dockerignore`, and IDE-specific configuration files for Rider and Visual Studio solutions. Logging functionality and Dockerfile are also included for runtime and build support.

Refactor Logger to support instance-based logging.
Updated the Logger class to include a `LoggerName` property, allowing differentiation between loggers. Replaced static methods with instance-based ones for greater flexibility and introduced improved logging format with `LoggerName` appended. Adjusted file logging to include caller information.

Add database handler and improve logging capabilities
Introduced `DatabaseHandler` for PostgreSQL operations including connection checks and query execution. Enhanced `Logger` to better handle markup and updated log file naming for more granular tracking. Added Npgsql dependency to support database integration.

Refactor GetCaller to provide detailed caller information.
Updated the GetCaller method to include detailed type, method, and file information, improving debugging capabilities. Added helper methods for extracting method names from compiler-generated types and simplifying file paths. Also included error handling for edge cases.
Refactor logger initialization and add ini-parser package reference.

Add configuration management system
Introduced ConfigManager for handling application configurations, including reading, updating, and creating default `config.ini` files. Updated logging to fetch the log directory from configuration and adjusted timestamp precision for better granularity.

Use dynamic log levels for logging.
This refactor retrieves the log level from the configuration and applies it to determine the verbosity of log messages. It also adds error handling for cases where the log level cannot be fetched, ensuring default behavior is maintained.

Remove deprecated logging configuration and streamline logging.
The "Logging" section in the configuration was removed as it is no longer used. Logging behavior was updated to rely on message content rather than configurable parameters. The changes reduce reliance on external configuration and simplify the logging logic.

Add support for loading database credentials from secrets
Introduced functionality to read and parse embedded `secrets.json` for database credentials, improving security and configurability. Updated dependencies to include necessary libraries like `Newtonsoft.Json` and adjusted the project setup to embed the secrets file as a resource. Defaults remain in place for missing values to ensure fallback compatibility.

Add critical log level handling to exit application on severe errors.
This ensures the application terminates when a critical-level log is triggered, preventing further execution in unstable states. The modification enhances the reliability and robustness of the error-handling mechanism.

Refactor secret parsing and enhance console message clarity.
Updated secret parsing to streamline JSON handling by avoiding redundant variables. Improved the clarity of the console output to better describe database query results. Commented out test code for more focused production execution.

Refactor logger setup and configuration handling.
Introduced a `SetupLogger` method to centralize logger initialization with dynamic log level and file path configuration support. Enhanced `ConfigManager` to include logging settings and improve error handling with automatic config backups. Logger class now supports runtime log level and file path changes while writing cached logs to the new file.

Add configuration validation and logger cleanup functionality
Implemented configuration file format validation with detailed error handling to ensure file integrity. Added a cleanup method to the Logger class for clearing internal log cache. Enhanced error reporting and backup creation during configuration loading failures.

Implement async disposal and cleanup in DatabaseHandler
Added IAsyncDisposable support and introduced a cleanup method to manage resources effectively in DatabaseHandler. Enhanced robustness by introducing disposal checks to prevent operations on disposed objects. Minor adjustments were also made to the Logger to fix logging behavior during directory creation.

Refactor database handling and configuration management.
Extracted repeated logic into reusable methods such as `GetSecrets`, `VerifyDatabaseConnection`, and `GetAllConfigurations`. Improved maintainability by simplifying and organizing the code. Enhanced cleanup process with proper disposal of database resources.

Refactor configuration and database utils into GeneralUtils
Moved VerifyDatabaseConnection and GetAllConfigurations methods from Program.cs to the new GeneralUtils class for better modularization and reusability. Introduced a utility method RemoveEmptyLines to clean up strings. Adjusted references in Program.cs to use GeneralUtils.

Update logger namespace to JarvisAI.Processes.Main
Refined the logger initialization to use a more specific namespace. This change improves clarity and organization in the logging structure.

Rename project to `Jarvis_V2_Console` and reorganize structure.
The project name and folder structure have been updated to use a consistent naming convention, replacing spaces with underscores. Related `.idea` files and solution configurations were regenerated or moved accordingly.

Add a welcome message with enhanced console display
Introduced `DisplayWelcomeMessage` using the Spectre.Console library to create a rich and interactive welcome screen. This feature provides user-friendly instructions and a visually appealing interface, improving the startup experience.

MESSAGE.value:
Add initial implementation of Jarvis V2 Console project
Introduced the Jarvis V2 Console project with core structure, including `Program.cs`, `Logger.cs`, Docker support, and build configuration. Added supporting files such as `compose.yaml`, `.gitignore`, `.dockerignore`, and IDE-specific configuration files for Rider and Visual Studio solutions. Logging functionality and Dockerfile are also included for runtime and build support.

Refactor Logger to support instance-based logging.
Updated the Logger class to include a `LoggerName` property, allowing differentiation between loggers. Replaced static methods with instance-based ones for greater flexibility and introduced improved logging format with `LoggerName` appended. Adjusted file logging to include caller information.

Add database handler and improve logging capabilities
Introduced `DatabaseHandler` for PostgreSQL operations including connection checks and query execution. Enhanced `Logger` to better handle markup and updated log file naming for more granular tracking. Added Npgsql dependency to support database integration.

Refactor GetCaller to provide detailed caller information.
Updated the GetCaller method to include detailed type, method, and file information, improving debugging capabilities. Added helper methods for extracting method names from compiler-generated types and simplifying file paths. Also included error handling for edge cases.
Refactor logger initialization and add ini-parser package reference.

Add configuration management system
Introduced ConfigManager for handling application configurations, including reading, updating, and creating default `config.ini` files. Updated logging to fetch the log directory from configuration and adjusted timestamp precision for better granularity.
Refactor log writing to use dynamic log levels from configuration.

Use dynamic log levels for logging.
This refactor retrieves the log level from the configuration and applies it to determine the verbosity of log messages. It also adds error handling for cases where the log level cannot be fetched, ensuring default behavior is maintained.

Remove deprecated logging configuration and streamline logging.
The "Logging" section in the configuration was removed as it is no longer used. Logging behavior was updated to rely on message content rather than configurable parameters. The changes reduce reliance on external configuration and simplify the logging logic.

Add support for loading database credentials from secrets
Introduced functionality to read and parse embedded `secrets.json` for database credentials, improving security and configurability. Updated dependencies to include necessary libraries like `Newtonsoft.Json` and adjusted the project setup to embed the secrets file as a resource. Defaults remain in place for missing values to ensure fallback compatibility.
Add critical log level handling to exit application on severe errors.

Add critical log level handling to exit application on severe errors.
This ensures the application terminates when a critical-level log is triggered, preventing further execution in unstable states. The modification enhances the reliability and robustness of the error-handling mechanism.
Refactor secret handling and improve console output message clarity.

Refactor secret parsing and enhance console message clarity.
Updated secret parsing to streamline JSON handling by avoiding redundant variables. Improved the clarity of the console output to better describe database query results. Commented out test code for more focused production execution.

Refactor logger setup and configuration handling.
Introduced a `SetupLogger` method to centralize logger initialization with dynamic log level and file path configuration support. Enhanced `ConfigManager` to include logging settings and improve error handling with automatic config backups. Logger class now supports runtime log level and file path changes while writing cached logs to the new file.

Add configuration validation and logger cleanup functionality
Implemented configuration file format validation with detailed error handling to ensure file integrity. Added a cleanup method to the Logger class for clearing internal log cache. Enhanced error reporting and backup creation during configuration loading failures.

Refactor database and logging logic for clarity and resiliency
Extracted reusable methods for database handling, configuration retrieval, and connection verification. Enhanced `DatabaseHandler` with async disposal and connection cleanup methods. Improved logging structure and fixed inconsistencies in log cache handling.

Implement async disposal and cleanup in DatabaseHandler
Added IAsyncDisposable support and introduced a cleanup method to manage resources effectively in DatabaseHandler. Enhanced robustness by introducing disposal checks to prevent operations on disposed objects. Minor adjustments were also made to the Logger to fix logging behavior during directory creation.

Refactor database handling and configuration management.
Extracted repeated logic into reusable methods such as `GetSecrets`, `VerifyDatabaseConnection`, and `GetAllConfigurations`. Improved maintainability by simplifying and organizing the code. Enhanced cleanup process with proper disposal of database resources.

Refactor configuration and database utils into GeneralUtils
Moved VerifyDatabaseConnection and GetAllConfigurations methods from Program.cs to the new GeneralUtils class for better modularization and reusability. Introduced a utility method RemoveEmptyLines to clean up strings. Adjusted references in Program.cs to use GeneralUtils.
Invalid configuration: openAiApiKey cannot be null or empty. API keys can be generated here: https://platform.openai.com/account/api-keys.

Update logger namespace to JarvisAI.Processes.Main
Refined the logger initialization to use a more specific namespace. This change improves clarity and organization in the logging structure.

Rename project to `Jarvis_V2_Console` and reorganize structure.
The project name and folder structure have been updated to use a consistent naming convention, replacing spaces with underscores. Related `.idea` files and solution configurations were regenerated or moved accordingly.

Add a welcome message with enhanced console display
Introduced `DisplayWelcomeMessage` using the Spectre.Console library to create a rich and interactive welcome screen. This feature provides user-friendly instructions and a visually appealing interface, improving the startup experience.
